title: God -Beyond Transcendence and Immanence: Imagination, eternity, evolution and the Quranic-God concept
summary: The Quranic view of the nature of God is neither that of transcendence, as a remote viewer and controller, nor is it pantheistic. God is seen as an incomparable 'Person', who has both originated and sustained creation; in fact, this 'Person' has a totally unique relation with 'space'. It is argued that an understanding of a unitary God is lacking, with respect to the unique 'personhood' of God; this paper, therefore, seeks to address this shortfall, by digging deeper. In the nominal Muslim world, the lack of understanding is attributable to four reasons: an anthropomorphic type of thinking about God, inordinate mysticism, a counter-reaction against mysticism, and mis-analysing the Quran, from both linguistic and contextual perspectives. In fact, the conventional views as they stand today have led to a misperception of the key issue of the 'placeness' of God. Placeness is discussed through the concept of two major factors: Imagination and Eternity, whereby it is evinced that an understanding of physics and cosmology also converges to a transcendo-immanent conception of God, or, in short, the trans-immanent conception of God, as the 'new emerging synthesis', where evolutionary 'design' and order are an integral and key part of that understanding.

Factors associated with early deaths following neonatal male circumcision in the United States, 2001-2010
summary: We sought to quantify early deaths following neonatal circumcision (same hospital admission) and to identify factors associated with such mortality. We performed a retrospective analysis of all patients who underwent circumcision while hospitalized during the first 30 days of life from 2001-2010 using the National Inpatient Sample (NIS). Over 10 years, 200 early deaths were recorded among 9,833,110 subjects (1 death per 49,166 circumcisions). Note: this figure should not be interpreted as causal but correlational: it may include both under-counting and over-counting of deaths attributable to circumcision. Compared to survivors, subjects who died following newborn circumcision were more likely to have associated co-morbid conditions, such as cardiac disease (OR: 697.8 [378.5-1286.6] p<0.001), coagulopathy (OR: 159.6 [95.6-266.2] p<0.001), fluid and electrolyte disorders (OR: 68.2 [49.1-94.6] p<0.001), or pulmonary circulatory disorders (OR: 169.5 [69.7-412.5] p<0.001). Recognizing these factors could inform clinical and parental decisions, potentially reducing associated risks.

Why did the church of the Roman Province of Africa disappear?
summary: This paper looks at the marginalisation of the church of North Africa from having been the dominant religion in the time of the late Roman Empire to its total disappearance by the time of the Ottoman conquest. The contrast with the persistence of the church in Egypt and the Middle East suggests some possible causes, specifically a lack of indigenisation, particularly among the Berbers, leaving the church as the religion of the Roman elite, a particular issue being the use of Latin rather than local languages. In addition of the divisions over Donatism, the Arian Vandal invasion and inflexibility of Western monasticism all make the church too weak to resist the Arab onslaught. The appeal of a religion that legitimated the traditional marauding of the Berbers was strong, and the change of form of worship is actually quite limited; in the end Islam offers more and demands less -for too many it was the chosen way forward.

title: Abrahamic Theology in the Perspective of Judaism, Christianity, and Islam
summary:
This paper is intended to examine the theology of Abraham who is the father of Judaism, Christianity, and Islam. The three religions have debated on several issues and fought in several battles. The one way is to break the wall that stood around them to know the origin of the three religions. Here, Ibrahim is a single actor as a way to answer the similarities and differences of the three religions. The story of Ibrahim still inspires the believer of all three faiths to become good Jews, Christians, and Muslims. Because the Abrahamic ethic is to maintain the pure monotheism, that there is no god except Allah, without any interruption and intervention of paganism and polytheism. Generally, this research is based on the history of mankind, and focuses on the study of the Bible and the Holy Qur'an. Through this research, the writer found few differences and similarities in the Bible and the Qur'an about the life of Abraham. Firstly, that Abraham will be the patriarch of the nations and the major religions. Secondly, Abraham is spiritual journey which an inspiration for Jews, Christians, and Muslims in performing their religious rituals. Then, the writer also found that the theological concept built by Abraham is monotheistic (tawh} i> d) and totally (ka> ffah) self-surrendering (aslama) totally to the Almighty God; rejecting all forms paganism and polytheism. 

Makalah ini dimaksudkan untuk meneliti teologi Ibrahim yang merupakan ayah dari agama Yahudi, Kristen, dan Islam. Seperti kita ketahui, ketiga agama telah berdebat di beberapa isu dan berperang dalam beberapa pertempuran. Salah satu cara untuk memecahkan tembok yang berdiri di sekitar mereka adalah dengan mengetahui asal-usul ketiga agama tersebut.
